abstract.text: Value type representing SMPTE/EBU timecode.

inlineContent.text: A variety of initializers and methods are available for string and numeric representation,
Mathematical operators are available between two instances:
Comparison operators are available between two instances:
can be formed between two instances
Many more features are detailed in the documentation

abstract.text: Standard MIDI File extension for MIDIKit.
Returns a copy of this instance, setting its timecode by converting from a time source.
Compare two
instances, optionally using a timeline that does not start at
00:00:00:00. Timeline length and wrap point is determined by the
property. The timeline is considered linear for 24 hours (or
100 days) from this start time, wrapping around the upper limit.
Subtract a duration from the current timecode and return a new instance.
Input values can be as large as desired and will be calculated recursively. ie: (0,0,0,1000) or (0,0,500,0)

If all subsequently smaller component values are already 0 then no
change is made of course.
Passing
has no effect, as it is the smallest component.
